item.title: Kerry add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "The lack of power to take joy in outdoor nature is as real a misfortune as the lack of power to take joy in books" -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "The best moments in reading are when you come across something - a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things - which you had thought special and particular to you. And now, here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out, and taken yours" -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Katherine Mansfield
item.description: "The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books." -- Katherine Mansfield

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "[D]on't ever apologize to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologize to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read... " -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Stephen Jay Gould
item.description: "I am, somehow, less interested in the weight and convolutions of Einstein’s brain than in the near certainty that people of equal talent have lived and died in cotton fields and sweatshops." -- Stephen Jay Gould

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Stephen Jay Gould
item.description: "People talk about human intelligence as the greatest adaptation in the history of the planet. It is an amazing and marvelous thing, but in evolutionary terms, it is as likely to do us in as to help us along." -- Stephen Jay Gould

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "The difference between stupid and intelligent people – and this is true whether or not they are well-educated – is that intelligent people can handle subtlety. " -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Kerry add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket
